We're talking changes a little bit bigger than that, but not by too much. Few examples:

* Frozen Heart: 2600g (was 2450g), 90 Armor (was 100 Armor).
* Banshee's: 2700g (was 2750g), 60 MR (was 55 MR), now builds from Crystalline Bracer instead of Ruby Crystal (total cost still the same, so combine cost's cheaper).
* Thornmail: 2300g (was 2100g), now reflects 15% damage + 25% of your bonus Armor (was 30% damage). Rewards using Thornmail with other armor effects, allows the damage reflect to still be significant against enemies dealing much of their damage through on hit effects instead of raw auto attack damage (e.g. Vayne). Significantly weaker as a sole Armor item however. This is about as big as this set of changes gets by the way, most of the others are just stat adjustments, not functionality changes.

It's damage calculation is being changed to be less based off the enemies AD, with damage instead also coming from the target's Armor, reducing the different in damage reflected for full AD builds versus on hit builds.

EDIT: Oh, and unrelated question, but since we're here, could you shed some light on the possibility of the Black Market items making it into the core game in some way or another?

Instead of an adc dealing 100 damage and taking 30 from thornmail it would now be...

An adc dealing 100 damage would take 15 from their own attacks, and 20 from the Bonus Armor damage, resulting in a net of 35 total.

Ah. Ok.

Still, take 600 damage (Common for critical strikes later in the game), that'd be 180 damage live compared to 110 with new Thornmail, you'd need to build about 280 more armor to catch up. That's a SHITLOAD of Bonus Armor, most of which is getting wasted. And they're nerfing Armor Items in general so... this seems like a fairly major nerf to Thornmail.

Not going to lie, this has me worried, unless they sneak in some buffs to other armor items in terms of anti-aa power, champions that rely on AAs like Yi are going to be out of control if it remains this way.

Thornmail was never supposed to be anti-auto attacker; randuin's does a way better job of that. Thornmail is supposed to be anti-lifesteal.

...and in that regard it's super OP. a tank can buy one item (and a cheap item at that) and nullify 30% lifesteal. BT gives 10%, and doesn't stack. you'd have to buy BT, BOTRK, AND essence reaver JUST to not be damaged by this one cheap item.

with the proposed change, thornmail counters BT, but may or may not counter BT and BOTRK, depending on how much armor you have. to use the numbers you posted:

 a champ with BT and BOTRK dealing 600AD damage to a thornmail would heal for 120, but be damaged for 90 by the 15% alone, leaving a scant 30 damage to be made up by the bonus armor passive. thornmail gives 100 bonus armor and deals 25% of bonus armor, lowering that total to 5. you would only need a 20 extra armor to completely nullify that champ's lifesteal.
Looking at thornmail, how could it possibly not be an anti-autoattacker item? Considering lifesteal is an autoattacker stat.

"BT gives 10%, and doesn't stack." A typo maybe? It gives 20%. BT is REALLY good at what it does. It also only doesn't stack with other BTs, because it's so powerful people would do that if it did.

Also one of the key weaknesses of an item like Thornmail is that the enemy can often attack someone else. Randuin's will still be able to slow you and gives hp. Frozen Heart will still slow your autos and gives its owner cdr and mana. Thornmail does nothing if an enemy doesn't hit you or only hits you with magic damage. Thornmail also already has a really high combine cost and a build path that's very commitment oriented. Tanks generally never buy GA and rarely are sitting on a chain vest unsure of if they want a Sunfire Cape or a Thornmail. This Thornmail nerf should really come with another cloth armor in the recipe at the very least.

Basically, Thornmail's damage reflection is based on the attacker's AD. If you have 200 AD, the damage reflection is 200 * 0.3 = 60 damage. It also multiplies on crits, and I think it adds in the damage bonus from Sheen-based items and a few champion abilities, but for some reason (last I knew), BotRK bypasses it. Don't ask me why, you'd have to ask someone from Riot.

Some people were thinking that Meddler said Thornmail would reflect the total damage of the attack--including any on-hit effects, as some people really want Vayne's Silver Bolts to be reflected by Thornmail.

What he *actually* said was that it would pose more of a threat to on-hit stackers, because the damage is now partially scaled on the wearer's Armor. The damage of Thornmail is no longer completely dependent on the attacker's stats.
I did the math, and I have to say, it doesn't sound good, since it deals considerably less damage on everything that you'd build Thornmail against.

Target has 100 AD. Old Thornmail would deal 30 damage return. New Thornmail would deal 15 + 25 = 40 damage return (Thornmail is +100 bonus Armor).

Target has 200 AD. Old Thornmail would deal 60 damage. New Thornmail would deal 55 damage; you need 20 more bonus Armor to match the old Thornmail.

Target has 400 AD. Old Thornmail would deal 120 damage. New Thornmail would deal 85 damage; you need 140 more bonus Armor to match the old Thornmail.

Target crits for 700 damage. Old Thornmail would deal 210 damage. New Thornmail would deal 130; you need 320 bonus Armor to match the old Thornmail.
---
In conclusion, it's going to be stronger against on-hit effect users than it used to be, but at the cost of less effect against normal AD stacking or crits.

Though, the irony of that is the fact that there is only one physical on-hit effect that isn't (or wasn't, if it was changed) reflected by Thornmail. All the rest are damage types against which Armor is worthless. In exchange for having built defense that does nothing against that damage type, we get to deal slightly more damage than it did in the past!

I mean, it's not the worst change they could have made, but dropping the damage reflection by half for that Armor scaling is losing the niche the item currently has for a trap gimmick.

False on the crit one. Normal crits are about 700, yes, BUT Thornmail does it based on the damage the attack WOULD HAVE done prior to armor. If they have 300 AD, you have 200 armor. About 100 from normal stuff plus 100 from the thornmail, usual. Old Thornmail would do 90 or it would do 225 on crit (2.5x from IE), but you'd only take 33% of the 750 crit unless they had LW. New Thornmail, you'd do 45+50=95. On crit, it'd do 112.5+50, which is 162.5. On crits, it's noticeable lower, but that's only on crits. This makes normal ADC builds more potent while Vayne, Yi, and other On-Hit based builds considerably weaker to Thornmail since they won't be critting enough.

Theoretically, you only have 55% crit with PD and IE. Say you have 300 AD. In 4 attacks, 2 of those will likely crit, 2 of them won't. That means it'll do 190 on the two non-crits and 325 in total on the crits, totaling 515. Old would've done 180+450, totaling 530. A difference of 15 damage in total. If you have more armor items, you can easily make up the difference since to make up for 15 damage, you only need 60 armor extra to total the 15 (Using the basic math formula for .25 times X equals 15, so you'd divide 15 by .25, totaling 60). Even high crit builds will be taking significantly more damage from the scary armor tanks like Rammus, Malphite, and Taric.
